Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2009 06:04PM melmedic06 wrote: i would plan on being uncomfortable and needing help (especially with small children) for at least 3-4 days- the SNB can be quite painful and depending on how much tissue they remove during the procedure you can have alot of swelling and may need to keep the breast wrapped up tightly and you will not be using that arm to it's full capacity for at least a week if not longer- honestly if your parents can stay for 3 days- i would ask them to!!  you do not want to be driving even if you are not taking narcotics- the range of motion on the side of your surgery is diminished and if you needed to react quickly to a situation on the road you may not be able to- i'm not being drama about all of this i am simply sharing my experience with you hoping you won't push yourself too hard- i took two weeks off from work and was very glad i did- good luck in your journey and keep the faith ladies- ILC    october 04   0.9cms   0/5 nodes negative lumpectomy radiation   left breast DCIS  august 05  found on mammotome- had lumpectomy- surgical tissue benign- radiation
Posts.Title: How long recovery from lumpectomy? Anxiousmama RMlulu

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 03:49PM melmedic06 wrote: every physician is different so if you are not having labs drawn that is his protocol- and one less thing for you to worry about!! i went on google and dogpile (and any other site i could find) and studied CEA and CA-125- WTMI but you can sort thru it if you are patient- my oncologist uses them strictly as a "broad" indicator of a possible reoccurence and since they have been done for my entire course of treatment- that is what i am used to- i might have to question mets being found strictly by exam and symptoms especially since so many us felt nothing with our diagnosis- just a personal thought- and happy news for me today- another negative mammo- NED :-)
Posts.Title: tumor markers- how much attention do you pay to them? melmedic06 hazelnut

Posts.Content: melmedic06 wrote: just had my 6 month labs drawn- my WBC'S are finally on their way up from 2.9 to 3.3 so i am happy about that but i wonder about my CEA- it is 1.8 (normal range 0.0 to 3.0) and has been 1.8 every time except for my first lab draw after my first radiation was complete and it was 0.5 then- my doctor says as long as it's normal he is not worried and i know having the same result year after year should be comforting but as well all know breast cancer makes you crazy with worry so i was wondering how much importance you ladies put in your tumor marker results- also had my CA-125 but that is not back yet- that has been consistently WNL's all along as well- thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: tumor markers- how much attention do you pay to them? melmedic06 hazelnut

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2007 12:51PM melmedic06 wrote: thank you ladies- it is always good to know you are not only in your concerns- i will continue to be vigilant with my mammograms and labs and report any changes to my oncologist- keep the faith!!
Posts.Title: breast still swollen - two years post radiation melmedic06 Binney4

Posts.Content: melmedic06 wrote: hi everyone- ILC- left breast- october 04- lumpectomy- 0.9cms- negative nodes- radiation- arimidex- DCIS found on mammotome in august of 05- lumpectomy done- benign breast tissue only- no DCIS- 6 more weeks of radiation- now november of 07 and my right breast is still swollen- all of my mammograms have been normal- my tumor markers are negative- i have had two chest x-rays- both negative- my oncologist says it is from radiating healthy tissue- i agree but wonder if anyone else has had radiation to a breast with no cancer and if so- do you have any swelling or discomfort? thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: breast still swollen - two years post radiation melmedic06 Binney4

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2008 04:59PM melmedic06 wrote: hi girls- i would like to join your group as well- i graduated from nursing school in december of 1994 and went to work as an RN in february of 05- i worked on the mother/baby floor for 4 years then did one year of L & D- left the hospital for a year and worked in a family practice office then an OB/GYN office and returned to hospital nursing on the mother/baby floor in 2000- i also got my paramedics license 2 years ago and work part-time doing that- i was dx'd in october of 04 (actually my first semester of medic school) with ILC- 0.9 cms- SNB negative- had a lumpectomy and 6 weeks of radiation (working the entire time at the hospital) then started on arimidex- in october of 05 back to medic school and in my 2nd semester- dx'd with DCIS found on steriotactic biopsy- had another lumpectomy but the breast tissue sent to path was totally benign-- surgeon said that does indeed happen- 6 more weeks of radiation- all the while working full-time and continue on with the arimidex- i work with 2 other RN's who have breast cancer- one is a 9 year survivor and one 7- i am praying to make it to my 5 year mark in october of 2009- it is wonderful to have found all of you and i look forward to many uplifting stories- keep the faith ladies-
Posts.Title: Nurses with Breast Cancer Jo_Ann_K PatRN10

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2009 11:23PM - edited Apr 12, 2009 11:26PM by melmedic06 i'm sure you are already taking yourself as far into the dark and unknown as you possibly can and wishing you could be positive along with the rest of your friends and family- i think it is impossible not to so i am sending lot's of positive karma and hope for good results but also letting you know as a two time survivor-whatever you hear you will be able to deal with it- stay strong has become such a cliche but they are words to live by- please keep us updated- keep the faith ladies- ILC- october 04- 0.9 cms- SNB- negative nodes- lumpectomy- radiation- arimidex DCIS - august 05 found during mammatome- BENIGN tissue found during lumpectomy- more radiation and still on arimidex-
Posts.Title: Can't Quite Wrap My Mind Around It All Yet.... SapphireSky scrapmom40
